website_summaries.verdict: A top name in weather monitoring devices that offers reasonable accuracy and useful features that make monitoring indoor and outdoor conditions fun and effective.
pros: Does a good job monitoring and predicting temperatures inside and outside
Has numerous features including barometer and humidity
Can be used with up to 3 consoles
cons: Screen is attractive, but is known to have a glare in some conditions and is difficult to read at some angles

customer_reviews.title: works amazing well and I like the new features
customer_reviews.text: I had the old Ambient weather wireless that was black and white for well over 4 years until the outdoor sensor went out of comission so decided to try the new color one..works amazing well and I like the new features, plus the color back ground is easy to read and the temps and barometer readings are accurate..well worth the price..
customer_reviews.author: charliedk

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival, would not except return or exchange
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these units, one did not work, to begin with. Spoke with Ed and John from customer support they would not exchange or take the return instead kept emailing me the link how to program. Just wasted $53.99 Faulty product, terrible customer service. Do NOT buy Ambient Weather
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Functions well; some minor display design issues
customer_reviews.text: I like the combination of functions on this unit, but have a few quibbles about the display design. Semi-major: The display gets dimmer and dimmer as you view it more and more from below horizontal. This is a problem if you hang it on the wall above sitting eye level or use the built in stand on a high shelf, as the stand tilts it backwards (towards being dim). Minor: The indoor and outdoor readings are the same color and size, and so are the indoor and outdoor humidity readings. If you are close to it, you can see the tiny text indicating which is which, but from across the room you have to know and remember which is which.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne E. Bretl

customer_reviews.title: Runs at 915MHz.  So does your smart meter. That's a problem.
customer_reviews.text: The problem with these units is they run on 915 megahertz. Wouldn't be an issue except all the smart meters being installed everywhere happen to run roughly in the same frequency which makes the unit work only if the remote is very very close to the display due to the RF interference. AcuRite has similar unit that runs in the 450 megahertz range and seems to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Norm Young

customer_reviews.title: Barometric Pressure
customer_reviews.text: This is the only unit I find helpful for managing barometric pressure migraines while measuring covariates like humidity. My spouse can look at the pressure and knows that if it is below 29.92 I am probably in pain. The only thing I wish it had is the ability to measure differential barometric pressure in the three locations, as the pressure in the basement feels a lot different than the pressure upstairs and it would be good to know the least painful area for me to hang out during such a migraine.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Keeping My Finger Crossed
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave this only a 4 star rating is because that similar weather stations by other manufacturers have always failed in what always seems too short order. This Ambient weather station looks great. The setup and programming is easy and I am really hoping for the best out of it. At this point only time will tell. Outside sending unit failed in about 12 months. Had same experience with Accurite and La Crosse products. All of their remote sending units seemed to die after about 12 months. Just not built to last. Replacement remote sending units are currently $13 on Amazon plus $10 shipping. Costs $24 a year to keep this thing working.
customer_reviews.author: Hoosier

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 24 hours of use.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking and displayed the info I wanted. After 24 hours of use the outside information stopped showing on the inside device. Waited a while to see if it would show up, it did not. Checked everything. Had new batteries and everything was correctly set. Disappointing. Thanks Amazon for the easy return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice weather station, but radio controlled clock feature doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to replace an old weather station with an LCD display that's become hard to read. This unit has a bright, easy-to-read screen, and lots of features. Our only disappointment is that we can't get the radio-controlled clock feature to work. It's supposed to pick up a radio time signal and use it to keep the clock accurate. At the suggestion of Ambient Weather technical support, we tried moving the remote units to different locations, but they don't seem to pick up the signal anywhere around our house. Our older weather station also has that feature, and it's clock has no trouble picking up the time signal.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Cleary

customer_reviews.title: Its alright but has issues in time
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this unit for the first couple months with the small footprint. Started have sensor issue at month 8 and had to reset occasionally to receive signal from outdoor unit. Now the unit doesn't read outdoor transmitter daily with reset daily. I spoke with Amazon customer service at month 8, they waled me through the reset process and directed me to the manual. Have past the service and warranty period now, what a dud. I would recommend a different unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a couple of problems...
customer_reviews.text: Displays a nice bit of information at a glance. Nice mounting or standing options. Display is nice. I have two problems: 1) Out of the box the inside temp was off compared to 3 other thermometers by 2-3 degrees. That's not good. You can calibrate it, but when it comes out of the box that far off you question how accurate it is. 2) The "last 24 hours" numbers reset at midnight. So it's not "last 24 hours", but "since midnight".
customer_reviews.author: craig in texas

customer_reviews.title: digital figures on bottom half of Screen failed.
customer_reviews.text: The Display Unit was great when first connected to power and sensed the outside unit. About 6 weeks following a very accurate and reliable display, the digital display on the bottom half of the display unit faded and finally failed. Vendor replaced the original unit with a LIKE display unit. The same display failure occurred at about 8 weeks after install. I will follow up with the vendor regarding the digital display failure. Bobw
customer_reviews.author: Bob Ware

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful display (unless you are sitting below it)
customer_reviews.text: Very colorful and informative display. Love how it "glows" at night. You can also see it nicely during the daytime. Only drawback (which is why i gave it 4 stars) is that I have it up higher on a computer desk (about 5ft high) so sitting below it I lose the image (like how you would on the older flat screen TV's). Seems to be better standing above it than below it.not sure why. All in all i really love looking at it each and every day.
customer_reviews.author: Amawalkgirl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read and so simple to set up.
customer_reviews.text: After 15 years of good service my old weatherstation died. I did a bit of research that quickly led me to this weatherstation. I had this new one out of the box and set up in five minutes. I got the model with two external sending units. One I put in the shade on the north side of my house. The other I put in my humidor in the back room. This weatherstation is easy to read, accurate (I tested it against a known accurate thermometer and hygrometer), and so easy to set up. I feel that the price was good too.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Fortenberry

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I needed. It has all the features we needed without spending a lot. The best part is that the outdoor units are replaceable (our old outdoor unit got attacked by a dog and could not pair an new unit to it). As others have reported it doesn't always pair up when you firs install the batteries but just follow the directions at the end of the book to have the unit re-scan for remotes. It connected quickly and has not lost connection since. once calibrated the readouts have always been with in a point or two of the official weather station. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: GoodGuy

customer_reviews.title: outdoor sensor can’t handle rain
customer_reviews.text: The outdoor sensor cannot handle all the rain we’ve had. It gets wet and then won’t read the temp and transmit until we bring it inside, take it apart and dry it out. The Ambient Weather product warranty information says it has a 1 yr warranty and the best customer service, but when I talked to a rep he acted like he didn’t believe me and said I needed to go to ambientweather.com and request a return. On their website, they say they only pay return shipping in the first 30 days. I’ve only had this 4 months. I’m not about to pay shipping to return a $15 sensor. My advice, don’t buy this.
customer_reviews.author: merry berry

customer_reviews.title: Great Weather station.
customer_reviews.text: Station is well built, and works just fine, with no issues. The instructions were written by a real technical writer, and are easy to understand. All of the remotes synchronized with no difficulty, and have worked ever since. Every feature on this device, and there are many, work as advertised. The temperatures are as accurate as needed in a home unit, within a degree or less. The only thing I would add is the ability to automatically scan all of the sensors, instead of manually scanning. That said, this is, indeed, an advanced wireless thermometer. It is the third unit I have purchased, and the only one that works.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Positive.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Buttons were on backwards. Failed in 4 hours.
customer_reviews.text: Buttons were assembled backwards, unit failed after 4 hours. LED contrast not adjustable so view angle very limited
customer_reviews.author: Bubbaloooo

customer_reviews.title: Remote monitor quit after less than 4 months. Do not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my parents to replace an Oregon scientific model. that had died. Initially it worked great, but only four months after we first started using it, it no longer will connect to the remote monitor. Very disappointed. Money out the window.
customer_reviews.author: Cinder

customer_reviews.title: Hey this thing is really nice! I bought it as a Xmas gift for ...
customer_reviews.text: Hey this thing is really nice! I bought it as a Xmas gift for my bf and the other day he showed me all the features. He said it takes a few weeks of getting the barometric pressure before it will start giving forecasts, so that part isn't working yet but the indoor/outdoor temps and humidity seems pretty accurate. He also likes seeing the moon phases. I may pick one up for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Love to Shop

customer_reviews.title: More attractive display than others on market
customer_reviews.text: I chose this one over many others due in part to the display, which is attractive and clean. The emphasis is on the temperature and humidity rather than the time or weather forecast. And you can adjust the brightness level with three settings. Two minor issues though. With the remote sensor standing not far from the display, you got differing indoor/outdoor readings in both temperature and humidity. Not major differences, though, and at times they agreed. Secondly, the remote sensor has a mounting screw on the curved upper portion of the unit, so if you have it secured tightly (so it won't get blown or knocked off), the unit doesn't hang straight (see photo).
customer_reviews.author: Discriminating Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well and syncs easily.
customer_reviews.text: This unit works very well and no problem syncing up with the outdoor transmitter. Be aware, however, that even though the outdoor unit is battery operated, the indoor unit requires that it be plugged in to operate. It does contain battery space for batteries to maintain the unit during a power outage.
customer_reviews.author: S. J. K. Haley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, but you’ll need tech support to set it up. Horrible directions.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. But the directions for setting this up are horrible from the company that made this device. The tech support man helped me but was very rude at first when I informed him I was college educated I know how to read and follow directions. He then helped me set this up. Other than that this is the second time I purchased this product. One was a gift six months ago. I love all the options it has. And who knows tech support man could have had a bad day. But when your dealing with a customer you should always at least be polite.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannine

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Weather Station
customer_reviews.text: This replaces a model from the previous seller that died (the barometer stopped working). I miss the bar-graph barometric-pressure trend display (this one just has a little up/down/steady arrow, although on another screen you can get a little more data on the trend), but otherwise this model is a good basic weather station. It seems fairly accurate (+/- 1 degree), and it's easy to set up and use. There aren't a ton of additional features, but for what to does it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: FPG

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoyed my WS-2801A weather station. Easy to set up & very easy to read. After 2 1/2 months I had a problem, the center section of the weather station couldn't be read. Only half of the digital display numbers were visable. I contacted the company asking for their advise on a fix or how they wanted it returned, they asked for a picture of the problem. Within a day they told me a new weather station would be mailed to me since it was under the 1 year warranty. It arrived a few days later. GREAT CUSTOMER SUPPORT, no problem resolving the issue & in a timely manner. Nice to know the company stands behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good little weather station
customer_reviews.text: Good size for end table / nite stand. Need to be a little closer to read it but love the ability to "calibrate" as many are not that accurate on temperatures. A bit longer to catch the time signal, but it did connect. Only using one remote station and instructions not real clear on how to pair with the remote station. I did determine that you use battery only power for this process. Plugging in the AC source first seems to confuse the signal pairing.
customer_reviews.author: GSXR

customer_reviews.title: Only works when plugged in
customer_reviews.text: It must be located within reach of a AC outlet. Batteries only provide backup, no display. Display is somewhat directional. Must stand it up a little straighter than stand is designed to do or can't see it sitting down. Might be okay if I could move it closer, but there's no AC outlet on my coffee table. I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Over a year of use and still working good
customer_reviews.text: Has been working properly for the year that iv'e had it. The sensor range isn't as good as listed in my case. On new batteries it's good, but after a few months it had a hard time going 20 feet through 2 walls. I moved the display unit closer and it's been fine. The clock can take awhile to set sometimes after power outages. Longest has been a few hours, but you can always manually set it if you don't want to wait.
customer_reviews.author: Notnamedsteve

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: Screen is easy to read, weather information is good Looses temperature & humidity contact with the outside part every few days and has to be reset. Poor instructions still have not figured out how to set the correct time zone. Had contact with tech help and they helped me set up but again have to reset about once a week
customer_reviews.author: Jay M.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working within 60 days of purchase
customer_reviews.text: This product was great when we bought it, but partially stopped working with 2 months of purchase. Some of the readings work and some no longer read.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Issues, Works well as described
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. It's been reliable and accurate for over a month now. I've noticed it has a good range on the transmitter. Distance from front to back of cement block home. I'm pleased it was able to synchronized the time too in my Florida location.
customer_reviews.author: Feedback Dave

customer_reviews.title: Accurate temperature
customer_reviews.text: I have had several other indoor outdoor setups over the past years. They were inexpensive and lasted a few years. This unit was a bit more expensive, but has lots more information. I also found the sensors were more accurate - generally within 1 degree F of each other. It also has a local data display on each unit. I purchased 2 remotes sensors. One was flaky. It always sensed/displayed the date but transmission to the base was intermittent. It finally quit, so I called the company. They were quick to respond with a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Nice color display and it is great to have multiple sensors. The scrolling of the remote sensors is a bit troublesome as it would be best to see all of them on the screen at the same time or at least be able to program which of the sensors display in a static fashion. Also, making the scroll function fully programmable would be nice as would a button to switch between showing remote sensor data. Otherwise, functional and useful.
customer_reviews.author: Marketing Man

customer_reviews.title: Good when it works
customer_reviews.text: It's informative and attractive BUT it regularly loses contact with the outside sensor. At first it was only when it rained but now it fails in good weather. To resuscitate it you have to unplug the master unit, remove the batteries from both, wait several hours and do the original setup procedure.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M Chused

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I presently own a few weather stations like this- different brands. Even in the most severe weather and worsening weather, this Ambient Weather WS-2801A never shows the rain/ thunderstorms/ lightning forecast icon, while the others consistently accurately show it. It either shows just some clouds or sunny. This is a major disappointment, and cannot recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A.

customer_reviews.title: A good little weather station.
customer_reviews.text: This clock/weather station works well. There are two minor drawbacks: it needs to be plugged in and where I live it took an extended period to be set by the atomic clock. Other than that I like it. The high and low humidity and temperature readings might be hard for some to read as they are small.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: This weather station is a good upgrade
customer_reviews.text: My old weather station died, this one was less expensive and has more features. It seems to be very accurate when I compare it to the local weather radio broadcast (including barometric pressure). The only downside is that even on the dim setting the backlight is pretty bright so I might get a timer for it to turn the light off at night. It's plenty bright to read in bright light during the day.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Miller

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I just bought the second one because my dog found the outside sensor and chewed it up. I had a few others before this one but this one is the best. Accurate, easy to read, with a few additional perks. It runs on battery, or you can plug it into the electric. which is how I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Troublesome to use
customer_reviews.text: This weather station device has a beautiful display and shows lots of useful information. However, I had to move the outdoor sensor very close to the house, which I think effects the accuracy of the data, because the inside unit lost the signal repeatedly. Now I get data from the outside sensor, but the time reading changes by several hours each time I reset it. It is beautiful but troublesome to use.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and easy to read.
customer_reviews.text: This weather station is easy to read and appears accurate. I have this for my travel trailer and love to be able to see outside temperature and humidity for Southeast Texas as well as inside temperature and humidity. Easy to read and seems pretty accurate. May get another soon for my house.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dale A. Stagg

customer_reviews.title: but it was really easy. Nice to have a modern unit
customer_reviews.text: It took a couple weeks to contact the Atomic Clock, and had to adjust the outdoor sensor a bit, but it was really easy. Nice to have a modern unit.
customer_reviews.author: Franbugs

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: We needed a new digital thermometer as the last one we had became inaccurate after 10 years of use. We’ve had this new one for a couple months now, and it’s working great! I like that this one also shows the humidity too. I definitely would recommend this one if this is what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Gene G. Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Great features for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The thermometer/hygrometer performed perfectly as received. Installation and set-up was easy and well explained in the detailed instruction booklet. The only criticism is that the batteries are only for back-up and the unit won't operate without being plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Technopeasant

customer_reviews.title: Hard to read and signal gets disconnected!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. I replaced a weather station I had previously that was much less expensive but I could read it by up to ten plus feet away! This unit I half to get up from the table to walk over to it just to see the outside temperature. - not very convenient. I also have to reset this one often to reconnect with the outside signal. Directions even include how to do this so it must be a common occurrence.
customer_reviews.author: Tell it like it is!

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Just set this up a week ago but works fine so far. I thought I just wanted a simple thermometer that gave indoor/outdoor temps but now that I have this I do enjoy knowing the humidity etc.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy K

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Based on initial use: Easy to set up. Accuracy is not perfect as the three monitors had 1 degree temperature differences and 1% differences in relative humidity between them, but well within the specifications. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Egolf

customer_reviews.title: RECOMMEND - A fascinating device
customer_reviews.text: RECOMMEND - A fascinating device. View it at least 5 times a day or night, every day. Bought another one as a gift for a friend who also is curious about “the weather”. A lot of info in an inexpensive, easy to set-up and use device. A great gift item.
customer_reviews.author: Stoked in Calif.

customer_reviews.title: Unit stopped receiving the remote sensor
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this review after having the unit for almost 2 years. It has stopped receiving the remote sensor and after working tech support I am being told I need to replace the unit but it is out of Warranty. I will be replacing the unit with one made by another manufacture.
customer_reviews.author: Cirrus22Joe

customer_reviews.title: Nice weatherstation for basic home use.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little weather station. I love that I can glance and see the outdoor temperature and humidity. The display reads very easily for me from a distance. It was very easy to program.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, but not nice functioning
customer_reviews.text: Try as we might, we could not get the wireless transmitter to sync with the weather station. It looks like a nice station and had all the stats we were looking for, but we could not get the system to work. We are pretty savvy with tech, so it wasn't as though amateurs were at the helm. We're sending it back and will try a different weather station and brand.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Small Weather Station
customer_reviews.text: Yhe Ambient Window WS-2800 was a huge surprise--small in size, but with everything you want in a weather station.I have looked at a number of different weather stations--much larger with poor color realization in the sun. This product is a great gift, and in comparison with other weather stations it's the only one with a 5-star rating. A best buy.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie Stanman

customer_reviews.title: An excellent little station.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little station, with everything needed at a glance. The display is backlit and is super easy to see all data in every type of lighting. Sensor reception is very, very good!
customer_reviews.author: Boo

customer_reviews.title: Atomic Clock Sync
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good, but the radio reception of WWVB atomic clock signal is spotty. The signal icon goes off for very long periods, but the time is on spot. Ambient Weather produces excellent devices.
customer_reviews.author: Beavis

customer_reviews.title: Range not as expected
customer_reviews.text: Recently encapsulated a crawl space and needed to monitor humidity. Placed two remotes under house 60 feet apart and one in attic above second floor. Base is on first floor equidistant between them. Only one unit is reading. All were set up together then moved. Very dissatisfied with range.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Beats all the rest with brilliant, colorful screen 24/7
customer_reviews.text: The lighted screen beats all the rest at night and pretty much during the day. The lighting puts this in a class above all the rest. Downside is need to plug in but what you get is worth the bother
customer_reviews.author: William J Jones

customer_reviews.title: seems to work
customer_reviews.text: It took 3 days for it get the radio signal for time sync. The remote temp took a few minutes to sync and is about 20 yards away with a wall and door and it still got signal. The only thing that was not good is the viewing angles of the lcd
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: There are better choices.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of two Ambient weather stations we purchased in May of this year. Both have failed to keep a constant outside temperature reading from the sensor which is located directly outside the window. There are better choices. Will be purchasing an Acurite system to replace the Ambient.
customer_reviews.author: Lastovfinst

customer_reviews.title: Great for indoor basement use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to keep track of the humidity levels of my basement. The daily low/high levels of humidity is great for knowing when to empty my dehumidifier. The daily temperature and humidity reset at midnight. The only downside to the product is the range when there are multiple walls from the sensor to the display module. Centralizing the display module allows for the most benefit if using multiple sensors. Overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain on this weather station.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy thanks to a good user manual. External remote detector was recognized right away and we've been enjoying the barometer through a few small rainstorms. Love that it displays millibars for pressure changes. Really nice product!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Berry

customer_reviews.title: does not sync- instuctions are awful
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are impossible to understand and the unit does not sync or and the time does not set correctly- the remote sensor only worked once then stopped. I have another company product that works just fine, I am sorry i bought this and it is too late to return
customer_reviews.author: Cindy C

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It's so nice to know whether need to put on coat or sleeveless top before heading out in a.m. This is not a complicated gadget that requires meteorological expertise to set up. It won't tell data a weather aficionado may want, but tells current temp., highs and lows.
customer_reviews.author: Donna E.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Accurate and displays alot of info. Easy to set up. Only complaint is unless you look at it directly the info fades out
customer_reviews.author: Lee from PA

customer_reviews.title: Will not stay on West Coast Time
customer_reviews.text: Love the weather station, temperature and humidity, etc. seems accurate, but it drives me crazy that is resets itself to EST daily. I live in California, not on the east coast.
customer_reviews.author: ClaudiaLSN

customer_reviews.title: won't hold outside temperature and humidity
customer_reviews.text: I like the thermometer except it won't hold the outside temperature and humidity. Tried resetting it several times. Changed channels and it worked for a couple of days, then quit again, May have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: cookie

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: So the inside temp was fine. But the 2nd zone outside was off by over 30 degrees after 2 weeks of use. I have to return due to a bad sensor. The sensor was approximately 20 feet from the main module.
customer_reviews.author: Robb

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I have had several external thermometers and this one is the best! It was easy to install and it found the wireless signal right out of the gate. Very nice unit with outstanding color display. It is a cut above all of the units that I have had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Edward S.

customer_reviews.title: "Weather Central" for our Home
customer_reviews.text: We are pleased with the weather forecast station. The visual appearance is attractive and the colorful graphics are visibly pleasing and easily readable. Installation was easy--I moved it a few times to get it out of the sun (easily done).
customer_reviews.author: Doktor Billigkeit

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Review
customer_reviews.text: Love the color display as it is easy to see and read and love the functions included. However, I have had a lot of difficulty keeping the outdoor transmitter connected to the main unit. Line of sight is less than 20 feet and one outside wall. When it is connected, the wireless signal strength shown appears to be high but then we will randomly find it not connected and have to press reset. I purchased lithium batteries for the transmitter and it hasn’t made much difference.
customer_reviews.author: G Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Ambient weather station-great unit.
customer_reviews.text: Great weather station. Easy to adjust settings. Easy to read and a snap to set up. Very happy I got this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Kevkat8

customer_reviews.title: Worked exactly as advertised and was very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Worked exactly as advertised and was very easy to set up. I also liked the fact that the readings could be adjusted/calibrated to a local standard.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Perna

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Great price and easy to set up. I LOVE this thing!
customer_reviews.author: L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas present for my son-in-law he really likes it. Now he can see the different temps, they raise chickens.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to see from across the room
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read and even set up. So far no problems with this one as I have had in the past with others. Prefer how this one lights up.
customer_reviews.author: lee hall

customer_reviews.title: Excellent inexpensive weather station.

product_meta.title: Ambient Weather WS-2801A Advanced Wireless Color Forecast Station w/Temperature, Humidity, Barometer
product_meta.description: Style Name:1 console / 1 remoteThe WS-2800 advanced wireless color forecast station is packed with features at a very affordable price and includes a logical, easy to read color screen layout. The WS-2800 features a color forecast icon that reacts to changes in barometric pressure, providing a forecast for upcoming weather in the next 24 to 48 hours with reasonable accuracy. Equipped with an atomic clock, time is set automatically via radio and in synch with the U.S. Atomic clock for utmost accuracy and automatically sets adjusts for daylight savings time. The remote wireless sensor transmits up to 300 feet line of sight (100 feet under most conditions) includes an LCD display, so the temperature and humidity can be read in both locations. Optional calibration is provided for the upmost accuracy, although calibration is optional and not required, the purpose of calibration is to fine tune or correct for any sensor Error associated with the devices margin of Error and inevitable sensor drift associated with electronic measurements. The measurement can be adjusted from the console to calibrate to a known source. Other features include min and Max that resets daily or manually, barometric pressure trend Arrow, and moon Phase.
